content.question: Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a twice-differentiable function with <math alttext="g prime of x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="g double prime of x, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> for all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="g of 3, equals 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="g of 5, equals 18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></math>. Which of <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="21" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>22</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are possible values for <math alttext="g of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?
